issue.title: [release-v1.49] Add DataImportCron CronJobs Proxy support

labels.name: release-note
labels.description: Denotes a PR that will be considered when it comes time to generate release notes.

labels.name: dco-signoff: yes
labels.description: Indicates the PR's author has DCO signed all their commits.

issue.body:
Manual backport of #2455

Signed-off-by: Arnon Gilboa <agilboa@redhat.com>

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
Use proxy certificates when creating DataImportCron CronJobs, so the pods won't fail on certificate issues when proxy is configured. `cdi-source-update-poller` was also fixed to use the proxy certificates.

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

**Release note**:
```release-note
Add DataImportCron CronJobs Proxy support
```

issue.title: Persistent containerDisk volumes

labels.name: lifecycle/rotten
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR that has aged beyond stale and will be auto-closed.

milestone.title: v1
milestone.description:
> Version 1 represents the minimal functionality we believe is necessary to meet our goal of being an IaaS virtual machine management platform ready for production use. It also means we have a well established process for community support ranging from an accurate user guide to clear plan for community release support.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KpCOIgiIfTsHQ_AA6xfr3ndgVc8fIs-BSUrdXFdVuxs/edit#

issue.body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:
 /kind enhancement

Persistent containerDisk volumes for simple VM workflows. This is “easy mode” for new users and people with simple production use cases. 

- Implementation TBD. this might be a delta qcow on a PVC, or it could be importing containerDisks to pvcs. We agreed that something needs to be done to streamline the usage of persistent container disks for first time users. 
- Need streamlined way of creating persistent VM. meaning not talking about installing CDI, or any other complications.  Needs to work out of the gate after installing KubeVirt. 
- Possibly Consider bundling kubevirt with CDI to streamline. <- Look at bundling this in a helm chart and see if that simplifies the install process.

comment.body:

issue.title: Persistent containerDisk volumes

labels.name: lifecycle/rotten
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR that has aged beyond stale and will be auto-closed.

milestone.title: v1
milestone.description:
> Version 1 represents the minimal functionality we believe is necessary to meet our goal of being an IaaS virtual machine management platform ready for production use. It also means we have a well established process for community support ranging from an accurate user guide to clear plan for community release support.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KpCOIgiIfTsHQ_AA6xfr3ndgVc8fIs-BSUrdXFdVuxs/edit#

issue.body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:
 /kind enhancement

Persistent containerDisk volumes for simple VM workflows. This is “easy mode” for new users and people with simple production use cases. 

- Implementation TBD. this might be a delta qcow on a PVC, or it could be importing containerDisks to pvcs. We agreed that something needs to be done to streamline the usage of persistent container disks for first time users. 
- Need streamlined way of creating persistent VM. meaning not talking about installing CDI, or any other complications.  Needs to work out of the gate after installing KubeVirt. 
- Possibly Consider bundling kubevirt with CDI to streamline. <- Look at bundling this in a helm chart and see if that simplifies the install process.

Signed-off-by: ci-robot <ci-robot@k8s.io>

Run hack/bump-prow.sh (#2408)

Signed-off-by: kubevirt-bot <kubevirtbot@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: kubevirt-bot <kubevirtbot@redhat.com>

Switch non-root sriov presubmit to optional (#2410)

The non-root sriov presubmit lane has been failing consistently.[1]
This issue has not been seen in the periodic sriov lane which runs
rootful. The issue looks to be non-root specific.

The sriov PFs are not available in the prow pod.

Updating the non-root sriov presubmit to optional and the rootful sriov
presubmit to required. This allows us to keep testing sriov without
blocking unrelated PRs while investigation into non-root issue is
ongoing.

[1] https://prow.ci.kubevirt.io/view/gs/kubevirt-prow/pr-logs/pull/kubevirt_kubevirt/8627/pull-kubevirt-e2e-kind-1.22-sriov-nonroot/1583370129192783872

Fix the namespace assignment for the script (#2403)

If there's no default ns defined in the current kubeconfig the script
will fail. This commit sets an explicit ns for the secret generation
and fetches, so that it will find the tokens.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

Use correct provider name for operator lane (#2413)

Since we are using sig-operator in k8s <= 1.24 already, let's update the
lane names to reflect reality for 1.25.

The update of the sig name for the automation will be done in a separate
PR.

NOTE: we are NOT updating the lanes for 1.24 <= to avoid losing
information in the testgrid dashboard!

issue.title: multus dynamic networks: validate configuration

labels.name: release-note
labels.description: Denotes a PR that will be considered when it comes time to generate release notes.

labels.name: dco-signoff: yes
labels.description: Indicates the PR's author has DCO signed all their commits.

issue.body:
The `multusDynamicNetworks` feature **depends** on multus; as such, ensure the multus dependency is present whenever the `multusDynamicNetworks` is requested.

Signed-off-by: Miguel Duarte Barroso <mdbarroso@redhat.com>

<!-- Thanks for sending a pull request!

Before you click the 'Create pull request' make sure that:
- This PR introduces a single feature of fix, just one
- This PR does not leave the main branch broken
- Every commit in this PR has a commit message explaining what do you change,
  why and what is the outcome
- If your change introduces a complex concept or a change to user interaction
  with the project or the application, make sure to document it

If you don't comply with these rules, you waste your energy, time of reviewers
and cause suffering of future generations.
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
The `multusDynamicNetworks` feature **depends** on multus; as such,
ensure the multus dependency is present whenever the `multusDynamicNetworks`
is requested.

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

**Release note**:
<!--  Write your release note:
1. Enter your extended release note in the below block. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".
2. Follow the instructions for writing a release note from k8s: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
3. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".
-->

```release-note
Ensure the CNAO configuration also features `multus` whenever the `multusDynamicNetworks` feature is requested.
```

issue.title: SnapshotForSmartClone doesn't work with storageclass volumeBindingMode WaitForFirstConsumer
issue.body:

create VM, stuck on SnapshotForSmartCloneInProgress

**What you expected to happen**:
VM status is running 

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

1. create storageclass with volumeBindingMode: WaitForFirstConsumer
2. make sure snapshot working, make sure snapshotclass is exist

commits.message:
cnao: add multus-dynamic-networks functests to presubmits (#2433)

For now we want to have it optional and not ran on demand to assert it
works as expected.

A follow PR will make the lane run always, and be required for CI's +1
vote.

Signed-off-by: Miguel Duarte Barroso <mdbarroso@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Miguel Duarte Barroso <mdbarroso@redhat.com>

Fix kubevirt lanes automation (#2427)

* Move operator to sig-operator

Adjust automation and tests accordingly, also fix should_modify
and should_not_modify test data.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Update changes to always_run for the sig jobs

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

Set enable CI report for test-benchmarks (#2434)

Currently, the CI results are not reported on PRs for the
test-benchmarks repo.

Signed-off-by: Alice Frosi <afrosi@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Alice Frosi <afrosi@redhat.com>

Add circuit breaker to flake-report-creator (#2414)

* Add tests for handling 404 and 504

To make this testable, create new interface BuildDataGetter for
dependency injection with default implementation. Extract method that
uses the interface while preserving the original.

Also add pending test for parallel execution that already proves that
the service is called many more times than wanted.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Add circuit breaker implementation

Also add another test that ensures that each underlying service call is
done at most two times from each thread

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Extract circuitbreaker to own package

Add unit tests

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Add function that decides whether to open circuit

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Use sync.RWMutex, rephrase occurred to blockedUntil

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Correct the test descriptions and expectations

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* We don't update the state if the retry is blocked

In case the interval for retry blocked has not yet expired
we do not update the circuit state with a new interval. This is
in order to not extend the interval if requests from a later point
in time than the initial opening request return with the same
error state.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Remove redundant check

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Move the lock to before the isRetryBlocked call

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Change default retry to Fixed with jitter

We don't want to use default retry.BackOffDelay since it would multiply
the wait time, which initially starts with 3 mins, instead we replace it
with retry.FixedDelay with RandomDelay added.

Also we add logging to circuitbreaker so log readers are able to
understand what is going on.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Update image in script

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

cnao: make multus-dynamic-networks lane mandatory (#2436)

Signed-off-by: Miguel Duarte Barroso <mdbarroso@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Miguel Duarte Barroso <mdbarroso@redhat.com>

Add common-instancetypes pre and post submit jobs (#2432)

Signed-off-by: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>

Add optional presubmit to test cluster-sync against perf cluster (#2435)

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

Only publish common-instancetypes image when it changes (#2437)

A new image should only be published when a change to the builder image
is merged

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

issue.title: Instancetype: Reintroduce informers in virt controller

labels.name: release-note-none
labels.description: Denotes a PR that doesn't merit a release note.

labels.name: dco-signoff: yes
labels.description: Indicates the PR's author has DCO signed all their commits.

issue.body:
/area instancetype
/cc @rmohr 
/cc @akrejcir 
/cc @davidvossel 

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

The use of these informers was previously removed by
https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/commit/ee4e266dd93b168cc84743a797f64aeb36d75d6b. After further discussions on
the ML [1] however it has become clear that the removal of these
informers from the virt-controller was not required and they can be
reintroduced, this change does this.

The virt-api continues to only use client calls to lookup instancetypes
and preferences.

One small change from the original implementation is that client calls
are now made if an object is not found within an informer. This is to
ensure the object is indeed missing and the failure has not been caused
by a race to update the associated informer.

[1] https://groups.google.com/g/kubevirt-dev/c/q_hR1tFH4Rk

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

This is currently based on https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8282 as that series already refactors lots of what we are touching here, only the final commit in this branch is for this PR. 

**Release note**:

2. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".

```

commits.message:
Wait for podman stop to successfully stop rsync container (#2461)

bazel-docker.sh is run numerous times during the large e2e jobs. Each
time the script is run a temporary rsync container is started. If one of
these rsync containers is not cleaned up correctly it can lead to rsync
daemon failuresi[1] when e2e jobs are run with podman.

podman stop[2] attempts to stop a container using SIGTERM if this fails
within the default 10 seconds a SIGKILL is used to forceably stop the
container. Previously the script was not waiting for the container to be
successfully stopped.

Also updating the wait before the SIGKILL to 1 second.

[1] https://prow.ci.kubevirt.io/view/gs/kubevirt-prow/pr-logs/pull/kubevirt_containerized-data-importer/2446/pull-containerized-data-importer-e2e-destructive/1582345804016783360#1:build-log.txt%3A1951
[2] https://docs.podman.io/en/latest/markdown/podman-stop.1.html#description

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

issue.title: [release-v1.49] Add DataImportCron CronJobs Proxy support

labels.name: release-note
labels.description: Denotes a PR that will be considered when it comes time to generate release notes.

labels.name: dco-signoff: yes
labels.description: Indicates the PR's author has DCO signed all their commits.

issue.body:
Manual backport of #2455

Signed-off-by: Arnon Gilboa <agilboa@redhat.com>

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
Use proxy certificates when creating DataImportCron CronJobs, so the pods won't fail on certificate issues when proxy is configured. `cdi-source-update-poller` was also fixed to use the proxy certificates.

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

```release-note
Add DataImportCron CronJobs Proxy support
```

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:
 /kind enhancement

Persistent containerDisk volumes for simple VM workflows. This is “easy mode” for new users and people with simple production use cases. 

- Implementation TBD. this might be a delta qcow on a PVC, or it could be importing containerDisks to pvcs. We agreed that something needs to be done to streamline the usage of persistent container disks for first time users. 
- Need streamlined way of creating persistent VM. meaning not talking about installing CDI, or any other complications.  Needs to work out of the gate after installing KubeVirt. 
- Possibly Consider bundling kubevirt with CDI to streamline. <- Look at bundling this in a helm chart and see if that simplifies the install process.

Signed-off-by: ci-robot <ci-robot@k8s.io>

Signed-off-by: ci-robot <ci-robot@k8s.io>
Co-authored-by: ci-robot <ci-robot@k8s.io>

Run hack/bump-prow.sh (#2408)

Signed-off-by: kubevirt-bot <kubevirtbot@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: kubevirt-bot <kubevirtbot@redhat.com>

Switch non-root sriov presubmit to optional (#2410)

The non-root sriov presubmit lane has been failing consistently.[1]
This issue has not been seen in the periodic sriov lane which runs
rootful. The issue looks to be non-root specific.

The sriov PFs are not available in the prow pod.

Updating the non-root sriov presubmit to optional and the rootful sriov
presubmit to required. This allows us to keep testing sriov without
blocking unrelated PRs while investigation into non-root issue is
ongoing.

[1] https://prow.ci.kubevirt.io/view/gs/kubevirt-prow/pr-logs/pull/kubevirt_kubevirt/8627/pull-kubevirt-e2e-kind-1.22-sriov-nonroot/1583370129192783872

fossa issues have been solved, we can now reliably run

j2 is required to template the multus-cni e2e test manifests, which are

Fix the namespace assignment for the script (#2403)

If there's no default ns defined in the current kubeconfig the script
will fail. This commit sets an explicit ns for the secret generation
and fetches, so that it will find the tokens.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

Use correct provider name for operator lane (#2413)

Since we are using sig-operator in k8s <= 1.24 already, let's update the
lane names to reflect reality for 1.25.

The update of the sig name for the automation will be done in a separate
PR.

NOTE: we are NOT updating the lanes for 1.24 <= to avoid losing
information in the testgrid dashboard!

issue.title: multus dynamic networks: validate configuration

labels.name: release-note
labels.description: Denotes a PR that will be considered when it comes time to generate release notes.

labels.name: dco-signoff: yes
labels.description: Indicates the PR's author has DCO signed all their commits.

issue.body:
The `multusDynamicNetworks` feature **depends** on multus; as such, ensure the multus dependency is present whenever the `multusDynamicNetworks` is requested.

Signed-off-by: Miguel Duarte Barroso <mdbarroso@redhat.com>

<!-- Thanks for sending a pull request!

Before you click the 'Create pull request' make sure that:
- This PR introduces a single feature of fix, just one
- This PR does not leave the main branch broken
- Every commit in this PR has a commit message explaining what do you change,
  why and what is the outcome
- If your change introduces a complex concept or a change to user interaction
  with the project or the application, make sure to document it

If you don't comply with these rules, you waste your energy, time of reviewers
and cause suffering of future generations.
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
The `multusDynamicNetworks` feature **depends** on multus; as such,
ensure the multus dependency is present whenever the `multusDynamicNetworks`
is requested.

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

**Release note**:
<!--  Write your release note:
1. Enter your extended release note in the below block. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".
2. Follow the instructions for writing a release note from k8s: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
3. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".
-->

```release-note
Ensure the CNAO configuration also features `multus` whenever the `multusDynamicNetworks` feature is requested.
```

commits.message:
cnao: add multus-dynamic-networks functests to presubmits (#2433)

For now we want to have it optional and not ran on demand to assert it
works as expected.

A follow PR will make the lane run always, and be required for CI's +1
vote.

Signed-off-by: Miguel Duarte Barroso <mdbarroso@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Miguel Duarte Barroso <mdbarroso@redhat.com>

Fix kubevirt lanes automation (#2427)

* Move operator to sig-operator

Adjust automation and tests accordingly, also fix should_modify
and should_not_modify test data.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Update changes to always_run for the sig jobs

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

Set enable CI report for test-benchmarks (#2434)

Currently, the CI results are not reported on PRs for the
test-benchmarks repo.

Signed-off-by: Alice Frosi <afrosi@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Alice Frosi <afrosi@redhat.com>

Add circuit breaker to flake-report-creator (#2414)

* Add tests for handling 404 and 504

To make this testable, create new interface BuildDataGetter for
dependency injection with default implementation. Extract method that
uses the interface while preserving the original.

Also add pending test for parallel execution that already proves that
the service is called many more times than wanted.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Add circuit breaker implementation

Also add another test that ensures that each underlying service call is
done at most two times from each thread

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Extract circuitbreaker to own package

Add unit tests

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Add function that decides whether to open circuit

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Use sync.RWMutex, rephrase occurred to blockedUntil

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Correct the test descriptions and expectations

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* We don't update the state if the retry is blocked

In case the interval for retry blocked has not yet expired
we do not update the circuit state with a new interval. This is
in order to not extend the interval if requests from a later point
in time than the initial opening request return with the same
error state.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Remove redundant check

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Move the lock to before the isRetryBlocked call

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Change default retry to Fixed with jitter

We don't want to use default retry.BackOffDelay since it would multiply
the wait time, which initially starts with 3 mins, instead we replace it
with retry.FixedDelay with RandomDelay added.

Also we add logging to circuitbreaker so log readers are able to
understand what is going on.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Update image in script

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

cnao: make multus-dynamic-networks lane mandatory (#2436)

Signed-off-by: Miguel Duarte Barroso <mdbarroso@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Miguel Duarte Barroso <mdbarroso@redhat.com>

Add common-instancetypes pre and post submit jobs (#2432)

Signed-off-by: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>

Add optional presubmit to test cluster-sync against perf cluster (#2435)

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

Only publish common-instancetypes image when it changes (#2437)

A new image should only be published when a change to the builder image
is merged

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

issue.title: Instancetype: Reintroduce informers in virt controller

labels.name: release-note-none
labels.description: Denotes a PR that doesn't merit a release note.

labels.name: dco-signoff: yes
labels.description: Indicates the PR's author has DCO signed all their commits.

issue.body:
/area instancetype
/cc @rmohr 
/cc @akrejcir 
/cc @davidvossel 

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

The use of these informers was previously removed by
https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/commit/ee4e266dd93b168cc84743a797f64aeb36d75d6b. After further discussions on
the ML [1] however it has become clear that the removal of these
informers from the virt-controller was not required and they can be
reintroduced, this change does this.

The virt-api continues to only use client calls to lookup instancetypes
and preferences.

One small change from the original implementation is that client calls
are now made if an object is not found within an informer. This is to
ensure the object is indeed missing and the failure has not been caused
by a race to update the associated informer.

[1] https://groups.google.com/g/kubevirt-dev/c/q_hR1tFH4Rk

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

This is currently based on https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8282 as that series already refactors lots of what we are touching here, only the final commit in this branch is for this PR. 

**Release note**:

2. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".

commits.message:
Wait for podman stop to successfully stop rsync container (#2461)

bazel-docker.sh is run numerous times during the large e2e jobs. Each
time the script is run a temporary rsync container is started. If one of
these rsync containers is not cleaned up correctly it can lead to rsync
daemon failuresi[1] when e2e jobs are run with podman.

podman stop[2] attempts to stop a container using SIGTERM if this fails
within the default 10 seconds a SIGKILL is used to forceably stop the
container. Previously the script was not waiting for the container to be
successfully stopped.

Also updating the wait before the SIGKILL to 1 second.

[1] https://prow.ci.kubevirt.io/view/gs/kubevirt-prow/pr-logs/pull/kubevirt_containerized-data-importer/2446/pull-containerized-data-importer-e2e-destructive/1582345804016783360#1:build-log.txt%3A1951
[2] https://docs.podman.io/en/latest/markdown/podman-stop.1.html#description

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

**Release note**:
```release-note
Add DataImportCron CronJobs Proxy support
```

issue.title: Persistent containerDisk volumes

labels.name: lifecycle/rotten
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR that has aged beyond stale and will be auto-closed.

milestone.title: v1
milestone.description:
> Version 1 represents the minimal functionality we believe is necessary to meet our goal of being an IaaS virtual machine management platform ready for production use. It also means we have a well established process for community support ranging from an accurate user guide to clear plan for community release support.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KpCOIgiIfTsHQ_AA6xfr3ndgVc8fIs-BSUrdXFdVuxs/edit#

issue.body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:
 /kind enhancement

Persistent containerDisk volumes for simple VM workflows. This is “easy mode” for new users and people with simple production use cases. 

- Implementation TBD. this might be a delta qcow on a PVC, or it could be importing containerDisks to pvcs. We agreed that something needs to be done to streamline the usage of persistent container disks for first time users. 
- Need streamlined way of creating persistent VM. meaning not talking about installing CDI, or any other complications.  Needs to work out of the gate after installing KubeVirt. 
- Possibly Consider bundling kubevirt with CDI to streamline. <- Look at bundling this in a helm chart and see if that simplifies the install process.

Signed-off-by: ci-robot <ci-robot@k8s.io>

Run hack/bump-prow.sh (#2408)

Signed-off-by: kubevirt-bot <kubevirtbot@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: kubevirt-bot <kubevirtbot@redhat.com>

Switch non-root sriov presubmit to optional (#2410)

The non-root sriov presubmit lane has been failing consistently.[1]
This issue has not been seen in the periodic sriov lane which runs
rootful. The issue looks to be non-root specific.

The sriov PFs are not available in the prow pod.

Updating the non-root sriov presubmit to optional and the rootful sriov
presubmit to required. This allows us to keep testing sriov without
blocking unrelated PRs while investigation into non-root issue is
ongoing.

[1] https://prow.ci.kubevirt.io/view/gs/kubevirt-prow/pr-logs/pull/kubevirt_kubevirt/8627/pull-kubevirt-e2e-kind-1.22-sriov-nonroot/1583370129192783872

and fetches, so that it will find the tokens.

issue.title: multus dynamic networks: validate configuration

labels.name: release-note
labels.description: Denotes a PR that will be considered when it comes time to generate release notes.

labels.name: dco-signoff: yes
labels.description: Indicates the PR's author has DCO signed all their commits.

issue.body:
The `multusDynamicNetworks` feature **depends** on multus; as such, ensure the multus dependency is present whenever the `multusDynamicNetworks` is requested.

Signed-off-by: Miguel Duarte Barroso <mdbarroso@redhat.com>

<!-- Thanks for sending a pull request!

Before you click the 'Create pull request' make sure that:
- This PR introduces a single feature of fix, just one
- This PR does not leave the main branch broken
- Every commit in this PR has a commit message explaining what do you change,
  why and what is the outcome
- If your change introduces a complex concept or a change to user interaction
  with the project or the application, make sure to document it

If you don't comply with these rules, you waste your energy, time of reviewers
and cause suffering of future generations.
-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
The `multusDynamicNetworks` feature **depends** on multus; as such,
ensure the multus dependency is present whenever the `multusDynamicNetworks`
is requested.

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

**Release note**:
<!--  Write your release note:
1. Enter your extended release note in the below block. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".
2. Follow the instructions for writing a release note from k8s: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
3. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".
-->

```release-note
Ensure the CNAO configuration also features `multus` whenever the `multusDynamicNetworks` feature is requested.
```

commits.message:
cnao: add multus-dynamic-networks functests to presubmits (#2433)

For now we want to have it optional and not ran on demand to assert it
works as expected.

A follow PR will make the lane run always, and be required for CI's +1
vote.

Signed-off-by: Miguel Duarte Barroso <mdbarroso@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Miguel Duarte Barroso <mdbarroso@redhat.com>

Fix kubevirt lanes automation (#2427)

* Move operator to sig-operator

Adjust automation and tests accordingly, also fix should_modify
and should_not_modify test data.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Update changes to always_run for the sig jobs

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

Set enable CI report for test-benchmarks (#2434)

Currently, the CI results are not reported on PRs for the
test-benchmarks repo.

Signed-off-by: Alice Frosi <afrosi@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Alice Frosi <afrosi@redhat.com>

Add circuit breaker to flake-report-creator (#2414)

* Add tests for handling 404 and 504

To make this testable, create new interface BuildDataGetter for
dependency injection with default implementation. Extract method that
uses the interface while preserving the original.

Also add pending test for parallel execution that already proves that
the service is called many more times than wanted.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Add circuit breaker implementation

Also add another test that ensures that each underlying service call is
done at most two times from each thread

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Extract circuitbreaker to own package

Add unit tests

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Add function that decides whether to open circuit

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Use sync.RWMutex, rephrase occurred to blockedUntil

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Correct the test descriptions and expectations

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* We don't update the state if the retry is blocked

In case the interval for retry blocked has not yet expired
we do not update the circuit state with a new interval. This is
in order to not extend the interval if requests from a later point
in time than the initial opening request return with the same
error state.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Remove redundant check

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Move the lock to before the isRetryBlocked call

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Change default retry to Fixed with jitter

We don't want to use default retry.BackOffDelay since it would multiply
the wait time, which initially starts with 3 mins, instead we replace it
with retry.FixedDelay with RandomDelay added.

Also we add logging to circuitbreaker so log readers are able to
understand what is going on.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

* Update image in script

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Daniel Hiller <dhiller@redhat.com>

cnao: make multus-dynamic-networks lane mandatory (#2436)

Signed-off-by: Miguel Duarte Barroso <mdbarroso@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Miguel Duarte Barroso <mdbarroso@redhat.com>

Add common-instancetypes pre and post submit jobs (#2432)

Signed-off-by: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Lee Yarwood <lyarwood@redhat.com>

Add optional presubmit to test cluster-sync against perf cluster (#2435)

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

Only publish common-instancetypes image when it changes (#2437)

A new image should only be published when a change to the builder image
is merged

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

issue.title: Instancetype: Reintroduce informers in virt controller

labels.name: release-note-none
labels.description: Denotes a PR that doesn't merit a release note.

labels.name: dco-signoff: yes
labels.description: Indicates the PR's author has DCO signed all their commits.

issue.body:
/area instancetype
/cc @rmohr 
/cc @akrejcir 
/cc @davidvossel 

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

The use of these informers was previously removed by
https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/commit/ee4e266dd93b168cc84743a797f64aeb36d75d6b. After further discussions on
the ML [1] however it has become clear that the removal of these
informers from the virt-controller was not required and they can be
reintroduced, this change does this.

The virt-api continues to only use client calls to lookup instancetypes
and preferences.

One small change from the original implementation is that client calls
are now made if an object is not found within an informer. This is to
ensure the object is indeed missing and the failure has not been caused
by a race to update the associated informer.

[1] https://groups.google.com/g/kubevirt-dev/c/q_hR1tFH4Rk

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes** *(optional, in `fixes #<issue number>(, fixes #<issue_number>, ...)` format, will close the issue(s) when PR gets merged)*:
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

This is currently based on https://github.com/kubevirt/kubevirt/pull/8282 as that series already refactors lots of what we are touching here, only the final commit in this branch is for this PR. 

**Release note**:

2. If no release note is required, just write "NONE".

```

commits.message:
Wait for podman stop to successfully stop rsync container (#2461)

bazel-docker.sh is run numerous times during the large e2e jobs. Each
time the script is run a temporary rsync container is started. If one of
these rsync containers is not cleaned up correctly it can lead to rsync
daemon failuresi[1] when e2e jobs are run with podman.

podman stop[2] attempts to stop a container using SIGTERM if this fails
within the default 10 seconds a SIGKILL is used to forceably stop the
container. Previously the script was not waiting for the container to be
successfully stopped.

Also updating the wait before the SIGKILL to 1 second.

[1] https://prow.ci.kubevirt.io/view/gs/kubevirt-prow/pr-logs/pull/kubevirt_containerized-data-importer/2446/pull-containerized-data-importer-e2e-destructive/1582345804016783360#1:build-log.txt%3A1951
[2] https://docs.podman.io/en/latest/markdown/podman-stop.1.html#description

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>

Signed-off-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Carey <bcarey@redhat.com>
